en: The telephone was being used at the moment.

en: Just then, the bus stopped.
zh: 就在那时，公交车停了。

en: Just then, the telephone rang.
zh: 就在那时，电话响了。

en: Just then, a bright idea occurred to me.
zh: 就在这时，我灵机一动。

en: I've just been to my uncle's house.
zh: 我刚去过我叔叔家。

en: We were just talking about you.
zh: 我们刚才正聊到你呢。

en: Let's get out of here.
zh: 咱们离开这儿吧。

en: Tulips come into bloom soon.
zh: 郁金香很快就要开了。

en: Tulips are our prefecture's official flower.
zh: 郁金香是我们县的县花。

en: Tulips are in full bloom now.
zh: 郁金香现在正盛开。

en: The tulips have begun to come up.
zh: 郁金香已经开始发芽了。

en: The tulips have come out beautifully.
zh: 郁金香开得真漂亮。

en: Zurich is the second largest gold market in the world after London.
zh: 苏黎世是仅次于伦敦的世界第二大黄金市场。

en: Don't hesitate. Speak out.
zh: 别犹豫，直说吧。

en: Far from hesitating, she willingly offered to help me.
zh: 她不但没犹豫，反而主动提出要帮我。

en: The Tudor Dynasty fell in the year 1603.
zh: 都铎王朝在1603年覆灭了。

en: The champion had the challengers at his mercy.
zh: 挑战者们完全受冠军的摆布。

en: The champion was welcomed by large crowds.
zh: 冠军受到了大批群众的欢迎。

en: The champion's experience submitted to the young opponent's power.
zh: 冠军的经验终究敌不过年轻对手的实力。

en: Can I change the channel?
zh: 我能换个台吗？

en: Do you mind if I change the channel?
zh: 介意我换个台吗？

en: Because the channel was changed he got angry.
zh: 因为被换了台，他生气了。

en: Turn to channel 1.
zh: 调到1频道。

en: You should eat something before you go.
zh: 你走之前得吃点东西。

en: Are you brushing your teeth properly?
zh: 你刷牙刷得认真吗？

en: Chew your food well so it can be digested properly.
zh: 细嚼慢咽才好消化。

en: Sit tight.
zh: 在那儿坐好了。

en: I expect you realised that without being conscious of it.
zh: 我想你可能没意识到，但你其实心里明白。

en: I'll not divorce you, unless you give me a good reason.
zh: 除非你给我个好理由，否则我不会跟你离婚。

en: I need one month to make a permanent bridge for you.
zh: 给你做固定牙桥需要一个月时间。

en: Don't let opportunities pass by.
zh: 别让机会溜走了。

en: Chances come rarely in any case.
zh: 不管怎么说，机会总是很难得的。

en: Chaplin left America for good.
zh: 卓别林永远离开了美国。

en: The door bell has rung.
zh: 门铃响了。

en: How do I get to Chinatown?
zh: 唐人街怎么走？

en: Prince Charles will be the next king of England.
zh: 查尔斯王子将成为下一任英国国王。

en: Charles Walcot investigated the magnetic compass bearing sense in pigeons.
zh: 查尔斯·沃尔科特研究了鸽子对磁感应方向的感知。

en: Charles I had his head cut off.
zh: 查理一世被砍了头。

en: Charles Lindbergh made the first solo flight across the Atlantic Ocean in 1927.
zh: 1927年，查尔斯·林德伯格完成了首次独自飞越大西洋的飞行。

en: Charlie was a mere child when I saw him last.
zh: 我上次见到查理的时候，他还是个孩子。

en: Charlie decided to cross out the last word.
zh: 查理决定划掉最后一个词。

en: Charlie's father advised him to become a teacher.
zh: 查理的父亲建议他去当老师。

en: Churchill was a worthy statesman.
zh: 丘吉尔是一位了不起的政治家。

en: In addition to being a great statesman, Churchill was a great writer.
zh: 除了是一位伟大的政治家，丘吉尔还是个伟大的作家。

en: The charter flight is to take off at three.
zh: 包机三点起飞。

en: Can I call "Chargeit" and reserve?
zh: 我能打电话用“Chargeit”预订吗？

en: People are talking about this Internet phenomenon.
zh: 大家都在谈论这个网络现象。

en: Don't be mean with the tip.
zh: 给小费别太小气了。

en: No gratuities accepted.
zh: 不收小费。

en: This tipping business always makes us uneasy.
zh: 给小费这事儿总让我们觉得不太自在。

en: If the tip was a dime in one glass, the waitress, in her haste to get the table ready for the next customer, would pick up the glass, the water would spill out, and that would be the end of it.
zh: 要是小费是放进杯子里的一个一角硬币，服务员急着给下桌客人收桌子，一拿杯子水就全洒了，那这事儿就麻烦了。

en: I am not the least bit worried.
zh: 我一点儿都不担心。

en: I don't have a ticket.
zh: 我没票。

en: To purchase a ticket, you need to enter your personal details.
zh: 买票需要输入个人信息。

en: I saw a lady go through the gate without showing the ticket.
zh: 我看见一个女士没检票就进站了。

en: I'd like to book three seats.
zh: 我想订三个位子。

en: The tickets sold out within a week.
zh: 票在一周内就卖光了。

en: Where can I buy tickets?
zh: 在哪儿买票？

en: Where can I get tickets?
zh: 在哪儿能弄到票？

en: Please pick up your ticket at the counter.
zh: 请到柜台取票。

en: Do you have any tickets left?
zh: 还有票吗？

en: The tickets are 20 yen each.
zh: 票价是每张20日元。

en: Can I buy tickets on the day of the tour?
zh: 游玩当天能买票吗？

en: As soon as we get the tickets, we'll send them to you.
zh: 我们一拿到票就给你寄过去。

en: Chicken, please.
zh: 请给我来份鸡肉。

en: You can't eat chicken? How do you know if you never try it?
zh: 你不吃鸡肉？不试一下怎么知道行不行？

en: Is it true that chicken soup will cure a cold?
zh: 喝鸡汤能治感冒是真的吗？

en: Check in, please.
zh: 请帮我办理入住。

en: Tell me what I should be watching for.
zh: 告诉我该注意些什么。

en: Can I leave my bags with you until I come to check in?
zh: 办入住之前，我能把行李存在这儿吗？

en: Can I check in now?
zh: 我现在能办入住吗？

en: I'll be a little late tonight for check-in.
zh: 我今晚办入住会晚一点。

en: I'd like to check in, please.
zh: 我想办理入住。

en: When is checkout time?
zh: 什么时候退房？

en: I'd like to check out.
zh: 我想退房。

en: Put everything on my tab. I'll settle it when I check out.
zh: 所有的都记在我的账上，退房时一并结算。

en: I'd like to check out. Do you have my bill?
zh: 我想退房，账单出来了吗？

en: I'd like to check out. Could you call the bellboy?
zh: 我想退房，能帮我叫下行李员吗？

en: What time do we have to check out?
zh: 我们几点得退房？

en: What do you say to a game of chess?
zh: 下盘棋怎么样？

en: The black and white squares on a checker board are arranged alternately.
zh: 棋盘上的黑白方格是交错排列的。

en: When it comes to playing chess, he is second to none.
zh: 说到下棋，他可是数一数二的。

en: Chess is a highly intellectual game.
zh: 国际象棋是一项极具智慧的游戏。

en: The chessboard is the world.
zh: 棋盘就是世界。

en: Will you teach me how to play chess?
zh: 你能教我下棋吗？

en: I will teach you to play chess.
zh: 我教你下棋吧。

en: Tom is more than a match for me in chess.
zh: 下棋的话，汤姆比我厉害多了。

en: I want to buy a Czech sweater.
zh: 我想买件捷克的毛衣。

en: The team won the championship for five years running.
zh: 这支队伍连续五年拿了冠军。

en: The team is up for the game.
zh: 队伍已经准备好比赛了。

en: As head of the team I was ably assisted by him.
zh: 作为队长，他帮了我不少忙。

en: Team members are provided with equipment and uniforms.
zh: 队员们都有发器材和制服。

en: Three cheers for the team.
zh: 为这个队欢呼三声吧！

en: Our team could easily have brought home the bacon, if it weren't for the team's best man being injured.
zh: 要不是我们最厉害的队员受伤了，我们队本来能轻松赢的。

en: It took a load off my mind when our team won the championship.
zh: 我们队夺冠后，我心里的石头总算落地了。

en: A cheetah runs as fast as any animal.
zh: 猎豹跑得和任何动物一样快。

en: I would like to buy some cheese.
zh: 我想买点奶酪。

en: Don't you know cheese is made from milk?
zh: 你不知道奶酪是牛奶做的吗？

en: Cheese doesn't digest easily.
zh: 奶酪不太好消化。

en: Cheese cuts easily with a knife.
zh: 奶酪用刀很容易切开。

en: Don't thrust your knife into the cheese.
zh: 别把刀猛地扎进奶酪里。

en: Cheese often lures a mouse into a trap.
zh: 奶酪经常用来把老鼠诱进陷阱里。

en: Which way is the cheese shelf?
zh: 奶酪柜台在哪边？

en: Would you teach me how to make cheese?
zh: 你能教我怎么做奶酪吗？

en: Cheese and butter are products made from milk.
zh: 奶酪和黄油都是牛奶做的。

en: Have you ever had cheese with apple pie?
zh: 你吃过苹果派配奶酪吗？

en: I'd like some cheese.
zh: 我想要点奶酪。

en: Could I have a slice of cheesecake?
zh: 能给我来块芝士蛋糕吗？

en: How is cheerleading practice?
zh: 啦啦队练得怎么样了？

en: I hope to try out for cheerleader.
zh: 我希望能参加啦啦队的选拔。

en: Make a handsome profit of one thousand dollars.
zh: 赚了一千美金，挺丰厚的。

en: Where are the tampons?
zh: 卫生棉条在哪儿？

en: Dan likes to make model cars.
zh: 丹喜欢做汽车模型。

en: Dan is good at making approaches to strangers.
zh: 丹很擅长搭讪陌生人。

en: Dan bought a new computer.
zh: 丹买了一台新电脑。

en: Dan did it with care but with ease.
zh: 丹做得既细心又从容。

en: Dan is often scolded by his mother.
zh: 丹经常被他妈妈骂。

en: Dan came for Julie at six.
zh: 丹六点去接朱莉了。

en: Dan's completely off the wall; you can't predict what he's going to do next.
zh: 丹这人完全不按常理出牌，你猜不到他下一步想干嘛。

en: It is getting cooler and cooler.
zh: 天气越来越凉快了。

en: His true colors are coming out.
zh: 他的真面目露出来了。

en: The days are getting longer and longer.
zh: 白天越来越长了。

en: It will get warmer and warmer.
zh: 天气会越来越暖和的。

en: The weather here is getting cold and I really do not like that.
zh: 这儿的天气变冷了，我真的一点都不喜欢。

en: It's getting colder and colder.
zh: 天气越来越冷了。

en: It was getting dark.
zh: 天快黑了。

en: It is getting darker and darker.
zh: 天色越来越暗了。

en: We were running out of gas, and what was worse, it began to snow heavily.
zh: 我们的油快没了，更糟的是，天开始下起大雪了。

en: How would you like to join the dance club?
zh: 你想不想加入舞蹈俱乐部？

en: Will you play some dance records?
zh: 能放点跳舞用的唱片吗？

en: Dancing is a delight to me.
zh: 跳舞对我来说是一种乐趣。

en: What time does the dance floor get crowded?
zh: 舞池什么时候开始人多起来？

en: How would you like to go to a dance?
zh: 你想去参加舞会吗？

en: Dancing is good for the figure.
zh: 跳舞对保持身材挺好的。

en: I cannot dance worth a damn.
zh: 我跳舞跳得烂透了。

en: Do you like dancing?
zh: 你喜欢跳舞吗？

en: Let me dance with you.
zh: 我陪你跳支舞吧。

en: We had a lovely time at the dance.
zh: 我们在舞会上玩得很开心。

en: Please enjoy yourself at the dance.
zh: 祝你在舞会上玩得开心。

en: My mother will attend to the baby while I go to the dance.
zh: 我去跳舞的时候，我妈会帮我带孩子。

en: Why don't you come dancing with me?
zh: 要不跟我一起去跳舞吧？

en: I take dancing and modeling lessons.
zh: 我在学跳舞和模特。

en: I found what I was looking for in the drawers.
zh: 我在抽屉里找到我要找的东西了。

en: What a pity you can't dance!
zh: 你不会跳舞真遗憾！

en: The dancer's graceful action charmed the audience.
zh: 舞者优雅的动作把观众都给迷住了。

en: Each movement of the dancer was perfect.
zh: 舞者的每一个动作都非常完美。

en: The dancers timed their steps to the music of the band.
zh: 舞者们跟着乐队的节拍在跳。

en: The dancers really came to life during the Latin numbers.
zh: 舞者们一跳起拉丁舞曲就特别有活力。

en: The tank has a capacity of fifty-gallons.
zh: 这个罐子容量是五十加仑。

en: There's little water in the tank, if any.
zh: 水箱里几乎没水了。

en: A tanker is a ship carrying oil.
zh: 油轮就是运油的船。

en: I have a lot of phlegm.
zh: 我痰特别多。

en: Taro succeeded to his late father's estate.
zh: 太郎继承了他父亲留下的遗产。

en: Taro, go and brush your teeth.
zh: 太郎，快去刷牙。

en: The tanker has only a small crew on board.
zh: 这艘油轮上的船员没几个。

en: I wonder who to invite.
zh: 我在想该请谁。

en: I love you more than anyone else.
zh: 我比任何人都爱你。

en: No one encouraged her.
zh: 谁都没有鼓励她。

en: None were satisfied.
zh: 谁都不满意。

en: None were listening to the speaker.
zh: 谁都没在听演讲。

en: Nobody was paying attention to her.
zh: 没人在意她。

en: Nobody argued against choosing him as chairman.
zh: 没人反对选他做主席。

en: No one can separate them.
zh: 谁也分不开他们。

en: No one ran ahead of him.
zh: 谁都没跑在他前头。

en: No one had the heart to say he was wrong.
zh: 谁也不忍心说他不对。

en: No one conceived his words to be important.
zh: 谁也没把他的话当回事儿。

en: Nobody knows why he left the town.
zh: 谁也不知道他为什么要离开镇子。

en: No one can achieve anything without effort.
zh: 不努力的话，谁也成不了事。

en: Nobody could give the correct answer.
zh: 谁也没能给出正确答案。

en: The plants must have died because no one watered them.
zh: 肯定是没人浇水，这些植物都干死了。

en: Nobody likes to be made fun of in public.
zh: 谁都不喜欢当众被取笑。

en: No one forgot their assignment, did they?
zh: 没人忘了作业吧？

en: No one wants to have an accident. The trouble is that people do not want hard enough to not have an accident.
zh: 谁也不想出意外，问题是，大家在防范意外上做得还不够。

en: No one can help me.
zh: 谁也帮不了我。

en: None of us want to go, but either you or your wife has to go.
zh: 我们谁都不想去，但你跟你老婆总得去一个。

en: Everyone is ready.
zh: 大家都准备好了。

en: Everyone, it seemed, was anxious to get their Christmas shopping done early this year.
zh: 看起来大家都想早点把圣诞节要买的东西买齐。

en: Everyone praises the boy.
zh: 大家都夸这男孩子。

en: No one could find the cave.
zh: 谁也找不到那个山洞。

en: Don't let anyone come near the fire.
zh: 别让任何人靠近火堆。

en: No man alive would believe it.
zh: 只要是个人都不会信。

en: Nobody has seen the bird fly.
zh: 谁也没见过那只鸟飞。

en: It seems that no one knows the truth.
zh: 好像谁都不知道真相。

en: It seems that no one knew the truth.
zh: 好像没人知道真相。

en: It is interesting that no one noticed that mistake.
zh: 挺有意思的，居然没人发现那个错误。

en: No one can understand how the accident happened.
zh: 谁也搞不懂那场事故是怎么发生的。

en: Everyone was enjoying the journey.
zh: 大家都挺享受那次旅行的。

en: Everybody knew her true feelings.
zh: 大家都知道她的真实想法。

en: Everybody knows for a fact that he is still alive.
zh: 大家都确实知道他还活着。

en: What person does everyone take off his hat to?
zh: 谁能让大家都肃然起敬呢？

en: Everybody is calling for sweeping reforms.
zh: 大家都呼吁进行大刀阔斧的改革。

en: Not everyone can be a poet.
zh: 不是每个人都能当诗人的。

en: Everyone is entitled to be moody once in a while.
zh: 谁都有权偶尔闹点小脾气。

en: Not everybody can be a poet.
zh: 不是每个人都能当诗人的。

en: Everyone was bustling about.
zh: 所有人都在忙前忙后的。

en: Everybody showed sympathy toward the prisoner.
zh: 大家都挺同情那个囚犯的。

en: She assumed that everyone would be for the plan.
zh: 她以为大家都会支持这个计划。

en: Everybody expected the musical to be a great hit, but it was far from being a success.
zh: 大家都觉得这出音乐剧会大火，结果压根儿没成功。

en: Everybody respects Jeremy because he carries out all his responsibilities.
zh: 大家都挺敬佩杰里米的，因为他总是尽职尽责。

en: Everyone is an entrepreneur.
zh: 人人都是创业者。

en: Nobody knows what has become of him.
zh: 没人知道他后来怎么着了。

en: No one ever saw such a thing.
zh: 谁都没见过这种事。

en: Whose go is it?
zh: 轮到谁了？

en: Everyone seems to have a bone to pick with someone, but only a few people can be philosophical about it.
zh: 好像每个人都对别人有点意见，但只有少数人能看得开。

en: Let no one interfere with me.
zh: 谁也别来干涉我。

en: Every man has his faults.
zh: 每个人都有缺点。

en: That should be pleasing to anyone.
zh: 这事儿谁听了都会高兴的。

en: Who is to blame for the failure?
zh: 这次失败该怪谁？

en: Who were you talking with?
zh: 你刚才在跟谁说话？

en: You must make an effort to get along with everyone.
zh: 你得努力和大家搞好关系。

en: Everybody has some good points and bad points.
zh: 每个人都有优缺点。

en: It is necessary that everybody obey the law.
zh: 每个人都必须遵守法律。

en: Everyone is more or less interested in art.
zh: 每个人多多少少都对艺术感兴趣。

en: Everyone more or less likes showing off in public.
zh: 每个人多多少少都爱显摆。

en: Nobody likes being laughed at.
zh: 没人喜欢被别人嘲笑。

en: Everyone has a right to enjoy his liberty, and all the more, his life.
zh: 每个人都有权享受自由，更有权享受生活。

en: Everybody seeks happiness.
zh: 每个人都在追求幸福。

en: You can invite any person you like.
zh: 你想请谁都行。

en: Everyone was more or less interested in the arts.
zh: 每个人当时多多少少都对艺术有点兴趣。

en: Every one wants to live free from care.
zh: 谁都想过无忧无虑的生活。

en: Anybody can make a mistake.
zh: 谁都会犯错。

en: All are welcome.
zh: 谁来都欢迎。

en: Everyone must keep the law.
zh: 大家都得守法。

en: It seems that everybody likes golf.
zh: 好像大家都挺喜欢高尔夫。

en: No one man could do it.
zh: 光靠一个人是干不了这事的。

en: Not everybody succeeds in life.
zh: 不是每个人都能在生活中取得成功。

en: Everybody loves music.
zh: 大家都喜欢音乐。

en: Everybody knows the news.
zh: 大家都知道这消息了。

en: Everyone and everything moved much faster now than before.
zh: 现在的人和事节奏都比以前快多了。

en: Anyone can use this dictionary.
zh: 谁都能用这本字典。

en: Everyone is not honest.
zh: 并不是每个人都诚实。

en: Give it to whoever needs it.
zh: 谁需要就给谁吧。

en: Everyone is responsible for his own actions.
zh: 每个人都要为自己的行为负责。

en: Not everyone can be a KRS-ONE.
zh: 不是谁都能成为 KRS-ONE 的。

en: Everyone of us will have to accept the current of the times.
zh: 我们每个人都得顺应时代潮流。

en: Everyone makes a mistake at times.
zh: 谁都有犯错的时候。

en: Everyone remembers the happy days of his youth as his halcyon days.
zh: 每个人都会把年轻时的快乐时光当作最美好的日子。

en: I want someone to talk to.
zh: 我想找个人聊聊。

en: Whoever comes, I'll welcome him warmly.
zh: 不管谁来，我都会热情欢迎。

en: Whoever comes, don't open the door.
zh: 不管谁来都别开门。

en: Who invented the telephone?
zh: 电话是谁发明的？

en: Who should look after the elderly?
zh: 该由谁来照顾老人？

en: There is no telling who will be sent in his place.
zh: 说不准会派谁来接替他。

en: There is no doubt as to who will be elected.
zh: 谁会当选是毫无疑问的。

en: Who left the window open?
zh: 谁把窗户开着没关？

en: If you have a bone to pick with a person, tell it to his face instead of saying things behind his back.
zh: 如果你对某人有意见，就当面说，别在背后指指点点。

en: There's somebody here who did it, isn't there?
zh: 肯定是这儿的哪个人干的吧？

en: Whoever may oppose my plan, I will carry it out nonetheless.
zh: 无论谁反对，我都要执行这个计划。

en: Who has taken my handbag?
zh: 谁拿了我的手提包？

en: Do you know who conquered Mt. Everest first?
zh: 你知道是谁第一个登上珠穆朗玛峰的吗？

en: No matter who may go, he will be welcomed.
zh: 不管谁去都会受欢迎的。

en: Somebody's at the porch!
zh: 走廊里有人！

en: Someone is at the door.
zh: 门口有人。

en: Who cares?
zh: 谁管呢？

en: Who is going to look after our dog?
zh: 谁来照看我们的狗？

en: Who cared?
zh: 谁在乎啊？

en: We will settle once for all who is the best.
zh: 我们要彻底定下来到底谁最厉害。

en: Who is in fault?
zh: 是谁的错？

en: To understand someone is to love someone.
zh: 理解一个人就是爱一个人。

en: You should not cut in when someone else is talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候你不要插嘴。

en: When you shake hands with somebody, you must look him in the eye.
zh: 跟人握手的时候，你得看着对方的眼睛。

en: I wonder who discovered it.
zh: 我在想这是谁发现的。

en: Who can put a bell on the cat?
zh: 谁能给猫挂上铃铛呢？

en: Who will compensate for the loss?
zh: 谁来赔偿这个损失？

en: It is still a mystery who wrote the letter.
zh: 谁写的这封信还是个谜。

en: Someone will do that job.
zh: 总会有人去干那活儿的。

en: Who looks after the children?
zh: 谁在照看孩子？

en: Who is behind the plot?
zh: 谁是幕后主使？

en: Who painted these pictures?
zh: 这些画是谁画的？

en: Whoever may say so, it is wrong.
zh: 不管谁这么说，都是不对的。

en: Who wrote this book?
zh: 这本书是谁写的？

en: Who has torn the envelope open?
zh: 谁把信封撕开了？

en: Who made the doll?
zh: 这个娃娃是谁做的？

en: Who made this plan?
zh: 这个计划是谁定的？

en: Somebody, open this door, please.
zh: 来个人，请把门打开。

en: Tell whoever comes that I'm out.
zh: 不管谁来，都说我出去了。

en: It smells as though someone has been smoking in here.
zh: 闻着好像有人在这儿抽过烟。

en: Someone entered the room.
zh: 有人进屋了。

en: Somebody must care for the patient.
zh: 必须得有人照顾病人。

en: He heard someone calling for help.
zh: 他听见有人在呼救。

en: Someone grabbed me from behind.
zh: 有人从后面拽住了我。

en: Someone seems to be calling me.
zh: 好像有人在叫我。

en: Someone hit me on the back.
zh: 有人在我背上打了一下。

en: Somebody took away my bag.
zh: 有人把我的包拿走了。

en: Someone is at the front door.
zh: 门口有人。

en: Someone is calling you.
zh: 有人找你。

en: Someone must have taken my umbrella by mistake.
zh: 肯定有人拿错我的伞了。

en: If there is somebody to back me up, the business will be successful.
zh: 要是有人支持我，这生意肯定能成。

en: If anyone should phone, say I'll be back at one o'clock.
zh: 要是有人打电话来，就说我一点钟回来。

en: Someone has left a bag on the bench.
zh: 有人把包落在长椅上了。

en: Somebody is playing the piano.
zh: 有人在弹钢琴。

en: Somebody is playing the piano. It must be Ann.
zh: 有人在弹钢琴，肯定是安。

en: They had been dancing for an hour when there was a knock on the door.
zh: 他们跳了一个小时舞，这时有人敲门。

en: Someone is battering at the door.
zh: 有人在使劲砸门。

en: Someone is tapping at the door.
zh: 有人在敲门。

en: He thought someone had put poison in his soup.
zh: 他觉得有人在他的汤里下了毒。

en: Someone has torn two pages out of this book.
zh: 这本书被人撕掉了两页。

en: Someone tried to poison our dog's food.
zh: 有人想往我们狗的食盆里下毒。

en: Who teaches you French?
zh: 谁教你法语？

en: Someone must have left it there.
zh: 肯定是谁把它落那儿了。

en: I'll arrange for someone to pick you up at your home.
zh: 我会找人去你家接你。

en: Can somebody get that?
zh: 谁能去接一下？

en: Who taught you how to dance?
zh: 谁教你跳舞的？

en: I feel listless and have a throbbing headache.
zh: 我觉得没精打采的，头还跳着疼。

en: The tarantula seized its victim very quickly.
zh: 捕鸟蛛很快就抓住了猎物。

en: It's duck soup for a girl of easy virtue to find a new man.
zh: 对那种放荡的女孩来说，找个新男人简直轻而易举。

en: It goes without saying that diligence is the key to success.
zh: 毫无疑问，勤奋是成功的关键。

en: Mr Tamori, may I introduce Mr Sanma Akashiya?
zh: 田森先生，我来介绍一下，这位是明石家秋刀鱼先生。

en: The telephone is out of order, Mr Tamori.
zh: 田森先生，电话坏了。

en: A sigh fell from her lips.
zh: 她叹了口气。

en: Don't hesitate to ask me any questions.
zh: 有什么问题尽管问我。

en: He who hesitates is lost.
zh: 犹豫不决就会错失良机。

en: Without a moment's hesitation, they took drastic action against the conspiracy.
zh: 他们毫不犹豫地对阴谋采取了果断行动。

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you, they say.
zh: 俗话说，要交那些对你有益的朋友。

en: Rather than doing any good, the rain did a great deal of harm to the crop.
zh: 这场雨不仅没好处，反而把庄稼给害惨了。

en: Any book will do as long as it is instructive.
zh: 只要有启发，什么书都行。

en: I was afraid it would not work out well and sure enough it failed.
zh: 我担心这事成不了，结果还真搞砸了。

en: Try solving the problem.
zh: 试着解决一下这个问题。

en: Let's take it for a month on trial.
zh: 咱们先试用一个月吧。

en: No, don't go yet.
zh: 不，先别走。

en: No! After you do your homework, you can watch television.
zh: 不行！写完作业才能看电视。

en: The villagers were displaced by the construction of a dam.
zh: 村民们因为修水坝搬走了。

en: There was a water mill below the dam.
zh: 水坝下面有个水磨坊。

en: The dam gave way and sent a great flush of water down the valley.
zh: 水坝决堤了，大水直冲山谷。

en: Pipe down, otherwise you will be hauled out.
zh: 小点儿声，不然你就被赶出去了。

en: Tama sometimes goes for a walk by himself.
zh: 多摩有时会自己去散步。

en: Onions cook more quickly than potatoes.
zh: 洋葱比土豆熟得快。

en: Sometimes her free manner seems rude.
zh: 有时候她那副随意的样子显得挺没礼貌的。

en: It's no crime to skip breakfast once in a while.
zh: 偶尔不吃早饭也没什么大不了的。

en: It's no crime to just idle the whole day once in a while.
zh: 偶尔整天无所事事也不算犯错。

en: You can't just work all day every day. You need to take a vacation once in a while.
zh: 你不能每天从早忙到晚，偶尔也得休个假。

en: Sometimes it's good for a married couple to go to a hot spring together—just the two of them.
zh: 夫妻俩偶尔单独去泡个温泉也挺好的。

en: Use your head for a change.
zh: 动动脑子行不行。

en: Once in a while, I visit the theater.
zh: 我偶尔会去剧院看看。

en: Why don't you dine out with me for a change?
zh: 咱俩偶尔也换换口味，出去吃一顿呗？

en: It's okay to take it easy sometimes.
zh: 偶尔放松一下也没关系。

en: You need to enjoy yourself and have fun once in a while.
zh: 你也得偶尔让自己开心一下，找点乐子。

en: How about dining out for a change?
zh: 要不咱们换个口味，出去吃吧？

en: Get out and have good clean fun once in a while.
zh: 偶尔也得出去散散心，找点健康的乐子。

en: Let's dine out for a change.
zh: 咱们偶尔也出去吃一顿，换换口味吧。

en: Come and see me once in a while.
zh: 有空偶尔来看看我。

en: Once in a while, the prophet indulges in fantasy.
zh: 先知偶尔也会陷入幻想。

en: More have repented speech than silence.
zh: 多说话比保持沉默更容易让人后悔。

en: It happened that her husband was a dentist.
zh: 碰巧她丈夫是个牙医。

en: It happened that I was in her room.
zh: 我当时刚好在她房间里。

en: It happened that I knew her by sight.
zh: 我正好跟她有过一面之缘。

en: It so happened that they were not there.
zh: 碰巧他们当时都不在那儿。

en: It happened that he was ill.
zh: 碰巧他那天生病了。

en: It chances that he is off duty today.
zh: 碰巧他今天不上班。

en: It happened that he was out.
zh: 碰巧他当时出去了。

en: It fell out that he could not come in time.
zh: 结果他没能准时赶到。

en: It happened that I met Mr Uno on the street.
zh: 我刚好在街上遇到了宇野先生。

en: That topic is too intimate to share with casual acquaintances.
zh: 那个话题太隐私了，没法跟一般熟人聊。

en: As it happened, I had no money with me.
zh: 真不凑巧，我身上没带钱。

en: It happened that we met at the station.
zh: 我们刚好在车站碰面了。

en: It happened that we were in London.
zh: 碰巧我们当时都在伦敦。

en: It happened that I met her in Tokyo.
zh: 我刚好在东京碰见了她。

en: I chanced to see him in town.
zh: 我正好在城里碰到了他。

en: As it happens, I have left the book at home.
zh: 真不凑巧，我把那本书忘家里了。

en: He was evidently surprised when he came across me.
zh: 他在遇见我的时候，明显吃了一惊。

en: It so happens that today is my birthday.
zh: 真巧，今天正好是我生日。

en: Mike happened to have been absent from school.
zh: 麦克碰巧那天没去上学。

en: I had a chance to meet him in Paris.
zh: 我刚好有机会在巴黎见到了他。

en: It happened that the train was delayed on account of snow.
zh: 不凑巧，火车因为下雪延误了。

en: It so happened that he was absent from school that day.
zh: 真不凑巧，他那天正好没去上学。

en: It happened that the day was my birthday.
zh: 刚好那天是我生日。

en: There happened to be a train accident early that morning.
zh: 那天一早碰巧发生了一起火车事故。

en: It happened that I met her at the station yesterday.
zh: 昨天我刚好在车站遇见了她。

en: It so happened that I had no money with me.
zh: 真不凑巧，我当时身上正好没带钱。

en: It happened that I sat next to her at a meeting.
zh: 开会的时候我正好坐在她旁边。

en: Just take my word for it.
zh: 你就听我的吧，准没错。

en: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.
zh: 想做成事总得有点牺牲。

en: Stop shooting the breeze and get to work!
zh: 别在那儿闲聊了，赶紧干活去！

en: It is likely to rain tomorrow.
zh: 明天大概会下雨。

en: It is probable that she will come.
zh: 她多半会过来。

en: Perhaps she doesn't remember my birthday.
zh: 也许她不记得我的生日了。

en: I should say he is a little angry.
zh: 依我看，他可能有点生气了。

en: Maybe the impulse was working upon her subconscious.
zh: 也许那是她潜意识里的冲动在作怪。

en: They'll probably come by car.
zh: 他们大概会开车过来。

en: Maybe he will be a good teacher.
zh: 或许他会成为一名好老师。

en: The chances are that he will succeed.
zh: 他很有可能会成功。

en: The chances are that he will win.
zh: 他很有可能会赢。

en: There is a chance that he will pass the exam.
zh: 他还是有机会通过考试的。

en: He will probably forget to return my book.
zh: 他大概会忘了还我书。

en: It may be that he will never be famous.
zh: 他可能永远也不会出名。

en: Probably he will come soon.
zh: 他大概很快就到了。

en: Chances are that he has not heard the news yet.
zh: 他可能还没听说那个消息。

en: It is possible that he may know the fact.
zh: 他可能已经知道真相了。

en: It is likely that he has made such a careless mistake.
zh: 他大概是犯了这么个粗心的错误。

en: It is probable that he forgot about it.
zh: 他估计是把这事儿给忘了。

en: He may well be right.
zh: 他说不定是对的。

en: I guess that would be all right.
zh: 我想那样应该没问题。

en: The chances are that the boss will send you to California.
zh: 老板很有可能会派你去加州。

en: Possibly, the accident will delay his arrival.
zh: 事故可能会让他晚到。

en: Possibly the factory will be closed down next week.
zh: 工厂下周可能会关门。

en: Perhaps it will rain in the afternoon.
zh: 下午可能会下雨。

en: Doubtless you have heard the news.
zh: 你肯定已经听说那个消息了。

en: The tea leaves all point to a merger, if you ask me.
zh: 要我说，这势头看起来就是要合并了。

en: It's going to rain.
zh: 要下雨了。

en: Maybe, but I can't catch the drift of even simple situations.
zh: 也许吧，但我连简单的情况都搞不清楚。

en: Maybe, but he wants me to stop cold turkey.
zh: 可能吧，但他想让我一下子就把烟戒了。

en: I guess that's just the way the cookie crumbles.
zh: 我猜这就是命吧。

en: In all probability, the cabinet will fall.
zh: 内阁很有可能会倒台。

en: In all probability, the money will not be paid.
zh: 这笔钱十有八九是不会付了。

en: I dare say you are right.
zh: 我敢说你是对的。

en: Maybe he has lots of girlfriends.
zh: 他可能有很多女朋友。

en: I should say he won't come.
zh: 我看他不会来。

en: The chances are that you can pass the test.
zh: 你很有可能能通过考试。

en: I've reserved a double.
zh: 我订了一个双人间。

en: I'd like a double room.
zh: 我想要个双人间。

en: I'd like a double with a bath.
zh: 我想要个带浴室的双人间。

en: Double, please.
zh: 麻烦给我个双人间。

en: You're tough.
zh: 你挺厉害的。

en: Loose jackets are the latest fad.
zh: 宽松夹克是最近的流行趋势。

en: I have been there scores of times.
zh: 我那儿去过好多次了。

en: You do such a thing once too often and get punished.
zh: 这种事儿做多了早晚要受罚。

en: Why don't you give up smoking?
zh: 你干嘛不戒烟呢？

en: Each package contains a score of cigarettes.
zh: 每包烟里有二十支。

en: I want to get cigarettes.
zh: 我想买包烟。

en: 67% of those who never smoked said they worried about the health effects of passive smoking.
zh: 67%从不吸烟的人说他们担心二手烟对健康的影响。

en: I wish I could give up smoking.
zh: 我希望我能把烟戒了。

en: Put out your cigarette. Smoking's not permitted here.
zh: 把烟掐了，这儿不准抽烟。

en: You must stop smoking.
zh: 你必须戒烟。

en: You will live longer if you don't smoke.
zh: 不抽烟你能活得久一点。

en: Don't you smoke?
zh: 你不抽烟吗？

en: I'd rather you didn't smoke so much.
zh: 我希望你别抽这么多烟。

en: Would you mind not smoking?
zh: 您能别抽烟吗？

en: Do you mind my smoking?
zh: 你介意我抽烟吗？

en: Smoking is permitted.
zh: 这儿可以抽烟。

en: Do you mind if I smoke?
zh: 我抽烟你介意吗？

en: I don't mind if you smoke.
zh: 你抽烟我不介意。

en: Would you mind if I smoke?
zh: 如果我抽烟的话，你介意吗？

en: The number of people who smoke is increasing, so cancer will soon be the most common cause of death.
zh: 抽烟的人越来越多，所以癌症很快就会成为最主要的死因。

en: Stop smoking.
zh: 别抽烟了。

en: It is often pointed out that smoking is a danger to health.
zh: 大家都说抽烟危害健康。

en: Smoking does you harm.
zh: 抽烟对身体有害。

en: It is not good for the health to smoke too much.
zh: 烟抽多了对身体不好。

en: He made a resolve to stop smoking.
zh: 他下定决心要戒烟了。

en: To give up smoking is not easy, but you should for the sake of your health.
zh: 戒烟不容易，但为了健康你还是戒了吧。

en: I long for a smoke.
zh: 我好想抽根烟啊。

en: You'd better give up smoking.
zh: 你最好把烟戒了。

en: If George doesn't stop smoking, he will run the risk of developing lung cancer.
zh: 要是乔治再不戒烟，他就有得肺癌的风险。

en: Please give up smoking.
zh: 请戒烟吧。

en: Smokers are asked to occupy the rear seats.
zh: 抽烟的人请坐后排。

en: Let me have a cigarette.
zh: 给我根烟抽。

en: Smoking does much harm but no good.
zh: 抽烟只有坏处没好处。

en: For thy sake, tobacco, I would do anything but die.
zh: 为了烟，我除了死什么都愿意。

en: Smoking has affected his health.
zh: 抽烟已经影响到他的健康了。

en: Tobacco acts on the brain.
zh: 烟草对大脑有影响。

en: You must not smoke.
zh: 你千万别抽烟。

en: Keep in mind that smoking is not good for your health.
zh: 记住，抽烟对身体不好。

en: The argument that smoking is injurious has become accepted.
zh: 抽烟有害健康这个观点已经被大家接受了。

en: Smoking is dangerous to health.
zh: 抽烟危害健康。

en: It goes without saying that smoking is bad for the health.
zh: 抽烟对身体不好是显而易见的。

en: Smoking is not good for the health.
zh: 抽烟对健康没好处。

en: Smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 抽烟对你身体不好。

en: I don't smoke.
zh: 我不抽烟。

en: I give my pledge that I will quit smoking.
zh: 我保证以后不抽烟了。

en: He says he will not give up smoking.
zh: 他说他不会戒烟的。

en: I prefer cigarettes smoked on the porch.
zh: 我更喜欢在阳台上抽烟。

en: It's hard to shake the smoking habit.
zh: 烟瘾很难戒掉。

en: You are requested not to smoke.
zh: 请不要吸烟。

en: Would you mind if I smoked?
zh: 你介意我抽烟吗？

en: You should smoke less.
zh: 你该少抽点烟。

en: Excessive smoking will injure your health.
zh: 抽烟过多会损害健康。

en: Would you please put out your cigarette?
zh: 请把烟掐了行吗？

en: Cigarette smoke fouls the air in a room.
zh: 烟味儿会让屋里的空气变差。

en: Tobacco smoke is productive of cancer.
zh: 烟草烟雾会致癌。

en: A new tax has been imposed on cigarettes.
zh: 香烟又要加税了。

en: There is a heavy tax on tobacco.
zh: 烟草税很高。

en: Let this smoky air out of the room and let some fresh air in.
zh: 把屋里的烟味排出去，换点新鲜空气进来。

en: Sometimes I smoke just to give my hands something to do.
zh: 有时候我抽烟只是为了找点事儿干。

en: Every time cigarettes go up in price, many people try to give up smoking.
zh: 每次烟一涨价，就有很多人想戒烟。

en: I was aching for a cigarette.
zh: 我刚才特别想抽根烟。

en: Please forget this, for the love of God.
zh: 求求你，把这事儿忘了吧。

en: Danny has no sense of beauty.
zh: 丹尼一点审美都没有。

en: I want to study abroad, even if my parents are against it.
zh: 就算父母反对，我也想出国留学。

en: I would keep waiting for you if I had to stay awake past midnight.
zh: 就算要熬到半夜以后，我也会一直等你。

en: I will go even if it rains tomorrow.
zh: 就算明天下雨我也要去。

en: Even if you are busy, you should keep your promise.
zh: 就算再忙，也得守信用。

en: I don't mind even if she doesn't come.
zh: 就算她不来，我也不介意。

en: Even if she comes to see me, tell her I am not at home.
zh: 就算她来找我，也跟她说我不在家。

en: Whatever she says, I don't believe her.
zh: 不管她说什么，我都不信。

en: Even if he is busy, he will come.
zh: 他就算很忙也会来的。

en: I will be friendly to him even if he doesn't like me.
zh: 就算他不喜欢我，我也会对他很友好的。

en: Don't trust him, whatever he says.
zh: 无论他说什么，都别信他。

en: No matter what he says, I'll never believe him again.
zh: 不管他说什么，我再也不信他了。

en: She believes him, whatever he says.
zh: 他说什么她都信。

en: Let him be a great statesman, I don't admire him.
zh: 就算他是个了不起的政治家，我也不崇拜他。

en: Even if he doesn't come here, I'll go on waiting for him.
zh: 就算他不来，我也会一直等下去。

en: I have to go even if it rains cats and dogs.
zh: 就算下大雨，我也得走。

en: Even if pigs were to fly in the air, I would believe her.
zh: 就算太阳从西边出来，我也信她。

en: I will go, be the weather what it may.
zh: 不管天气怎么样，我都会去。

en: Whomever you may ask, you can't get a satisfactory answer.
zh: 你问谁都没法得到满意的答复。

en: Whoever telephones, tell him I'm out.
zh: 不管谁打电话来，就说我不在。

en: No matter who says so, I don't believe it.
zh: 不管谁这么说，我都不信。

en: Whoever may say so, I don't believe it.
zh: 谁说我都不信。

en: Even if there is a convention, I shouldn't ask them for so much money.
zh: 就算有惯例，我也不该跟他们要这么多钱。

en: I will go even if it should rain heavily.
zh: 就算下大雨我也会去。

en: Even if the sun were to rise in the west, I would not change my mind.
zh: 就算太阳从西边出来，我也不会改变主意。

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would never agree to your plan.
zh: 就算太阳从西边出来，我也绝不会同意你的计划。

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would not break my word.
zh: 就算太阳从西边出来，我也不会食言。

en: I always buy a top quality product even if it is slightly more expensive.
zh: 就算贵一点，我也总买质量最好的。

en: I have a watch that is nice, if not new.
zh: 我这块表挺不错的，虽然不是新的。

en: A watered down compromise resolution is better than none at all.
zh: 哪怕是个缩减版的折中方案，也比没有强。

en: If he fails, so what?
zh: 就算他失败了，那又怎样？

en: Even if you have your own way, you will not always be successful.
zh: 就算你按自己的想法做，也不一定总能成功。

en: If not confidently, at least hopefully.
zh: 就算没信心，起码也要抱点希望。

en: If I am dull, I am at least industrious.
zh: 就算我这人挺闷的，起码工作还挺努力。

en: Even if we do this, it will be another sixty years before the Antarctic ozone hole is repaired.
zh: 就算我们这么做了，南极臭氧层空洞也要再过60年才能修复。

en: Even though I was right, he got the best of me.
zh: 虽然我是对的，但他还是占了上风。

en: Even if I am wrong, you are not quite right.
zh: 就算我错了，你也不见得全对。

en: Even if he is in trouble, Mac is always optimistic.
zh: 就算遇到了麻烦，麦克也总是很乐观。

en: You have another chance even if you fail this time.
zh: 就算这次失败了，你还有机会。

en: All people can become friends, even if their languages and customs are different.
zh: 哪怕语言和习俗不同，大家也都能成为朋友。

en: Even if you make great efforts, you won't be able to achieve it.
zh: 就算你再怎么努力，也没法做到。

en: Granting you were drunk, I cannot excuse you.
zh: 就算你当时喝醉了，我也没法原谅你。

en: Even if you stop me, I won't change my mind.
zh: 就算你拦着我，我也不会改变主意。

en: Whatever you may say, I will not change my opinion.
zh: 无论你怎么说，我也不会改变看法的。

en: Even if you don't like music, you'll enjoy his concert.
zh: 就算你不喜欢音乐，也会喜欢他的音乐会的。

en: He didn't like to ask for help even if he was starving.
zh: 他就算饿着肚子也不愿意求人帮忙。

en: Even though he is learned, I can't respect him.
zh: 就算他很有学问，我也没法尊重他。

en: No matter how cold it is outside, the rooms are comfortably heated.
zh: 不管外面多冷，屋里都很暖和。

en: I'll follow you, come hell or high water.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都会跟着你。

en: Go through fire and water.
zh: 赴汤蹈火。

en: Even if I have to sell my house, I'll keep my business going.
zh: 就算得卖房子，我也要把生意做下去。

en: Live where she may, she always enjoys her surroundings.
zh: 无论住在哪儿，她总能自得其乐。

en: No matter what you may do, you must do your best.
zh: 不管你做什么，都要尽力而为。

en: Even when she thought about something else, ideas of death returned to her mind.
zh: 就算她在想别的事，死的念头还是会冒出来。

en: Whatever happens, you must keep calm.
zh: 不管发生什么，你都要保持冷静。

en: No matter what may happen, I am always prepared for it.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都做好了准备。

en: Don't change your plans, whatever happens.
zh: 不管发生什么，都别改变你的计划。

en: No matter what happens, you must be here by nine.
zh: 不管发生什么，你九点前必须到这儿。
